headline: American Airlines Flight Cancellations Persist as Rivals Move Past Winter Storm
summary: Airlines have largely recovered from winter storm Fern’s snow and ice, but American Airlines continues to struggle.  As of midafternoon, more than 950 American flights scheduled for Tuesday have been scrapped.  Regional carrier PSA Airlines, which operates American-branded flights, has shed over a quarter of its schedule.

headline: Alaska Air Group: Attractive Earnings Outlook
summary: Alaska Air Group, Inc. is rated a Buy, driven by recovering corporate demand and rising premium mix. Learn more about ALK stock here.

headline: American Airlines, JetBlue Shares Are Dropping After Earnings
summary: American Airlines  stock slid early Tuesday as the carrier’s fourth-quarter earnings fell short of expectations but management provided upbeat guidance for 2026.  The carrier reported adjusted earnings per share of 16 cents from revenue of $14 billion.  Wall Street was looking for earnings of 37 cents per share, while revenue was in line with expectations.

headline: American Airlines Stock Flies, JetBlue Falls After Earnings. Why They’re on Different Flight Paths.
summary: American Airlines and JetBlue Airways reported earnings Tuesday but the stocks were moving in opposite directions.

headline: United Expects Biggest Summer Yet at Chicago O'Hare, Growing to Record 750 Flights Per Day
summary: United today announced it will reach 750 flights per day this summer from Chicago O'Hare International Airport (ORD), 200 more than its next largest competitor and the largest schedule ever flown by any airline operating here.

headline: IYT: The Largest Transportation ETF Is Also An Economic Indicator
American Airlines projects revenue growth for 2026, misses earnings estimates for fourth quarter
summary: American expects to earn 7% to 10% more revenue in the first three months of 2026.
